Gryffindor	"Gryffindor is one of the four houses at Hogwarts
column2: founded by Godric Gryffindor. The house prizes bravery
column7: and daring in their students. Its colors are red and gold
column8: and its symbol is the lion. Its house ghost is Sir Nicholas de Mimsy-Porpington
column9: also known as ""Nearly-Headless Nick."" Gryffindor and Slytherin houses are fierce rivals.

column1: The Gryffindor common room is located in one of the castle's towers
column2: the entrance to which is guarded by an oil painting known as the Fat Lady. One must say the right password
column4: in order to enter."	house	Hogwarts	/static/images/gryffindor.jpg	Godric Gryffindor	The Triwizard Tournament	Nearly-Headless Nick	red and gold	lion	"You might belong in Gryffindor

column1: Where dwell the brave at heart
Their daring
Set Gryffindors apart."
Ravenclaw	"Ravenclaw is one of the four houses at Hogwarts
column2: founded by Rowena Ravenclaw. The house prizes learning
column8: and intellect in its students. Its house colors are blue and bronze
column9: and its symbol is the eagle. The house ghost is the Grey Lady

column1: The Ravenclaw common room is located in a high tower
column2: which one may only enter after solving a logical riddle given by a bronze eagle-shaped knocker. This could be considered troublesome
column3: since anyone with enough intellect could enter the tower
column5: and this has happened before. However
column6: most witches and wizards lack a sense of logic
column7: which may be why Rowena chose to set up the security this way."	house	Hogwarts	/static/images/ravenclaw.jpg	Rowena Ravenclaw	None	The Grey Lady	blue and bronze	eagle	"Or yet in wise old Ravenclaw

column1: If you've a ready mind
Where those of wit and learning
Will always find their kind."
Slytherin	"Slytherin is one of the four houses at Hogwarts
column2: founded by Salazar Slytherin. The house prizes cunning
column10: and power in their students. Its colors are green and silver
column11: and its symbol is the serpent. Its house ghost is the Bloody Baron. Slytherin and Gryffindor houses are fierce rivals. Most Slytherin students are pure-blood
column12: due to the founder's mistrust of Muggle-born witches and wizards. Slytherin has a bad reputation as it is known that most dark wizards and witches are produced from Slytherin house. Most notably
column15: and most of his Death Eater followers were Slytherins.

column1: The Slytherin common room is located in the dungeons underneath the Black Lake. To enter
column2: one must say the correct password in front of a stone wall
column3: which will then reveal a concealed stone door."	house	Hogwarts	/static/images/slytherin.jpg	Salazar Slytherin	Chamber of Secrets	The Bloody Baron	green and silver	serpent	"Or perhaps in Slytherin

column1: You'll make your real friends
Those cunning folk use any means
To achieve their ends."
Hufflepuff	"Hufflepuff is one of the four houses at Hogwarts
column2: founded by Helga Hufflepuff. The house prizes dedication
column9: and loyalty in their students. Its colors are yellow and black
column10: and its symbol is the badger. Its house ghost is the Fat Friar. Hufflepuff appears to have the least rivalry with the other houses
column11: possibly as they are less competitive or humble about their accomplishments due to their house traits. Due to Helga Hufflepuff's policy of accepting any student
column12: Hufflepuff is often thought as the house with the less talented wizards
column13: even though there have been exceptional witches and wizards from Hufflepuff. It is also notable that Hufflepuff has produced less dark wizards than any other house at Hogwarts.

column1: The Hufflepuff common room has never been seen by outsiders and is the only house with repelling devices. Its entrance is located somewhere near the kitchens."	house	Hogwarts	/static/images/hufflepuff.jpg	Helga Hufflepuff	The Triwizard Tournament	The Fat Friar	yellow and black	badger	"You might belong in Hufflepuff
Where they are just and loyal
